page.title: 03The Manchester Ship Canal.
page.content: The Manchester Ship Canal runs 35 miles from{Eastham}on the{Mersey}to within a mile of the centre of {Manchester.}Begun 1887 and completely open in 1894 the construction involved 16000 navvies,80 steam excavators and land dredgers with 5 locks raising the level 60 feet.Water level is maintained at a depth of 28-30 feet allowing ocean going vessels of 12500 -15000 tonnes to pass through.Heyday of the canal is now past and as a whole it no longer makes a profit.The section between{Runcorn & Manchester} is to be closed with Runcorn becoming the terminus.At present the Runcorn Docks service the whole of the canal with tug and maintainance services as well as providing a terminal for chemical imports and exports.
